summary.p: 241 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 15; Qurʾānic Text: Q 17:1-end; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 142 x 93mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 21: "61 E. H. 15. Kur’anın 2. Yarısı. Parşömen ve kâğıt. 93mm boy ve 142mm eninde cönk biçiminde 241 yaprak. Sahifede III-IV. (IX-X) asıra ait kûfi ile 115mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Arada bir çok kısımları eksildiğinden Arap neshi ile kâğıt üzerine yazılmak suretiyle tamamlanmıştır. Parşömen kısımları yine aynı malzeme ile tamir edilmiştir. Miklepli ünnabî deri cilt. Bu mushaf İsrā (17) suresinden Kur’an’ın sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "61 E. H. 15. The second half of the Qurʾān. Parchment and paper. 241 junk shaped leaves of 93 mm height and 142mm width. The codex begins with Q 17 (Sūra al-ʾIsrāʾ) and ends with Q 18 (Sūra al-Kahf). The text area written in Kufic script of 3rd-4th (9th-10th) century [contains] 15 lines measuring 115 mm. Since many [leaves] were missing, it was completed by being written on paper with naskh. The parchment parts were repaired with the same material. Leather unnabī binding with flap (miklep). The codex is from Q 17 (Sūra al-ʾIsrāʾ) until the end of the Qurʾān."
